banner.btext: Kuliah ke luar negeri? Salak Ed siap membantu anda!

frontText.textsec: Expert study abroad guidance from A4 Admission

second.textp1: A4 Admission is a leading education consultancy specializing in study abroad programs for high school and university students. We offer tailored admissions support for top destinations like Canada, the USA, the UK, Malta, Russia and Australia.
second.textp2: Our global presence with teams in Asia, Europe And the USA, ensures seamless assistance at every step, from university selection to visa processing and post-arrival settlement.

forth.p: We believe everyone deserves a transformative future by accessing the world’s best education opportunities
forth.p3: First-Hand Experience – Our team studied, worked, and lived in the USA & Canada
forth.p4: 100+ Partner Institutions across major Canadian provinces for seamless settlement
forth.p5: 100% Employment Support via career coaching & industry ties
forth.p7: End-to-End Living Support  From visas to cultural adaptation

fifth.des1: Let’s talk! Sit down with our experienced counselors to discuss your study goals, preferred destination, academic background (GPA), and budget.
fifth.des2: Based on your profile, we’ll recommend the best-fit universities or colleges – including tuition fees, application deadlines, and future employment opportunities.
fifth.des3: No guesswork here. We’ll walk you through exactly what you need – from transcripts and passports to English test scores and letters of recommendation.
fifth.des4: Once you're ready, we’ll take care of submitting your applications and handling the necessary fee payments – all on your behalf.
fifth.des5: 🎉 Good news! If selected, you’ll receive your official Letter of Acceptance (LOA) from the institution.
fifth.des6: With your LOA in hand, you can confidently pay your tuition fees directly to the school.
fifth.des7: Our experts will help you prepare and submit your visa application, ace the interview, and ensure all immigration paperwork is in order.
fifth.des8: We’ll assist with flight bookings, airport pickups, and housing arrangements through our trusted overseas partners.
fifth.des9: Prepare for success! Our final session equips you with essential knowledge and tips for your first week abroad – covering banking, safety, and culture.
fifth.headingbuttom: Your Global Journey Begins Here – With A4 Admission by Your Side!

objective.heading: We believe every people deserve to have a meaningful life by pursuing the best education that the world can offer to.
objective.icon1: 25+ years accumulated experience in the industry
objective.icon2: First-hand experience to study, work, and live in Canada and United States
objective.icon3: We have partners in major Canada provinces to help students get settled in Canada
objective.icon4: 100% employment rate through program career coach
objective.icon6: We understand it is not easy to live abroad, we are here to help students to get the best living experience

left.hb2: Set the foundation for a smoother, more rewarding journey abroad.
left.p1: We help you select a university that not only matches your academic goals but also supports your long-term success making your journey abroad smoother and more fulfilling.

program.ph1: More Than 1000 Programs to Choose From

engineering.el1: Aviation, Aero Space and Pilot Technology

topText.catp: Canada consistently ranks as one of the best countries in the world to live in, thanks to factors like its excellent healthcare system, high stkamurd of education, and overall quality of life. Many Canadians enjoy a good work-life balance, and the country is known for its friendly, welcoming atmosphere.

subTextL.subhfp0: Canadians are known for being friendly, open and tolerant and Canada welcome students’s from more  than 200 ethnic origins.
subTextL.subhfp1: Canada is a bilingual country and its considered a world leader in language training since teaching of French and English as a frist and second languages is an integral part of a Canadian education.
subTextL.subhfp2: The education system in Canada is grounded in a culture of research and development with excellent research facilities supported by Canadian goverment and industry.
subTextL.subhfp3: Some international students with Canadian credentials and Canadian work experience may apply for permanent residency without having to leave Canada.
subTextL.subhfp4: Cost of living and tution fees for internasional students are generally lower in Canada than in other countries.
subTextL.subhfp5: The United Nations consistenly ranks Canada as one of the best places in the world to live. You will enjoy all of the freedoms which protect Canadians: respect for human rights, equality, and a stable and peaceful society.
subTextL.subhfp6: From wired libraries and Olympic-quality sports facilities, to public concert halls and art galleries, Canada’s post-secondary campuses offer you enormous possibilities to combine learning and leisure.
subTextL.subhfh7: Work During Your Study & Work Permit After Graduate
subTextL.subhfp7: Opportunity to work part-time on- or off-campus up to 20 hours per week while study in Canada. You may also work full-time on a scheduled break (e.g summer break). This will help you to save up some money. Opportunity post-graduate work permits up to 3 years.

subTextR.subpr1: Rencanakan masa depanmu dengan Salak Ed
subTextR.subrpt1: With over 25 years of industry experience and nationwide partnerships
subTextR.subrpt2: High acceptance rates, international experience, and comprehensive support
subTextR.subrpt3: 100% employment rate and focus on a great living experience

thirdText.thfh1: Living cost major cities in Canada
thirdText.thfh1p1: Toronto is Canada's largest city and one of the most expensive places to live in the country. The cost of living in Toronto is driven up by high housing prices, transportation costs, and food expenses. The average rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city center is around CAD 2,000 per month, while the cost of a meal at a mid-range restaurant is around CAD 20.
thirdText.thfh1p2: Vancouver is a coastal city in Western Canada and is known for its stunning natural scenery. The cost of living in Vancouver is high due to high housing prices, transportation costs, and food expenses. The average rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city center is around CAD 1,900 per month, while the cost of a meal at a mid-range restaurant is around CAD 20.
thirdText.thfh1p3: Montreal is the second-largest city in Canada and is located in the province of Quebec. The cost of living in Montreal is generally lower than in Toronto and Vancouver, although it can still be expensive. The average rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city center is around CAD 1,200 per month, while the cost of a meal at a mid-range restaurant is around CAD 15.
thirdText.thfh1p4: Calgary is a city located in the province of Alberta and is known for its thriving oil and gas industry. The cost of living in Calgary is generally lower than in Toronto and Vancouver, although it can still be expensive. The average rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city center is around CAD 1,400 per month, while the cost of a meal at a mid-range restaurant is around CAD 20.
thirdText.thfh1p5: Ottawa is the capital city of Canada and is located in the province of Ontario. The cost of living in Ottawa is generally lower than in Toronto and Vancouver, although it can still be expensive. The average rent for a one-bedroom apartment in the city center is around CAD 1,400 per month, while the cost of a meal at a mid-range restaurant is around CAD 20.
thirdText.thfh1p6: Manitoba is a province located in the central part of Canada. The cost of living in Manitoba is generally lower than in some of Canada's larger cities. The average rent for a one-bedroom apartment in Winnipeg, Manitoba's largest city, is around CAD 1,100 per month. The cost of a meal at a mid-range restaurant in Winnipeg is around CAD 15It's important to note that these costs are just estimates and can vary depending on your lifestyle and specific circumstances.
thirdText.thfh2p1: All international students must obtain a study permit to live and study in Canada. A study permit is a document issued by the Government of Canada that allows international students to study at a designated learning institution (DLI) in Canada for a specific period of time. The processing time for a study permit can vary depending on factors such as your country of origin and the time of year. On average, it takes 20 business weeks to process the study permit after you complete the biometrics, and if you meet the eligibility.
thirdText.thfh2p2: International students in Canada may be eligible to work up to 20 hours per week on or off campus while they study. To work off-campus, you must have a study permit and be enrolled in a full-time program. You may also be eligible for a post-graduation work permit after you complete your program of study. Depending on your length of study, international students can obtain Post Graduate Work Permit (PGWP) up to there years.
thirdText.thfh2p3: Minimum wage in Canada varies depending on the provinces. As of year 2022, the minimum wage rates in Canada are as follows:
thirdText.thfh2p3l5: Newfoundland and Labrador: CAD 12.50 per hour
thirdText.thfh2p3l10: Prince Edward Island: CAD 13.25 per hour
thirdText.thfh2p4: A program offered by many universities and colleges that allows students to gain practical work experience in their field of study. Students are typically required to meet academic performance standards and complete specific courses before being eligible for co-op placements. Most co-op placements last between four and eight months. Co-op programs are popular in Canada because they offer many benefits to students, including the opportunity to gain work experience, develop professional networks, and earn money to offset the cost of tuition. Co-op programs can also help students clarify their career goals and make more informed decisions about their future career paths.
thirdText.thfh3p5: Canada is a country located in North America, spanning from the Atlantic Ocean in the east to the Pacific Ocean in the west, and northward into the Arctic Ocean. It is the second-largest country in the world by land area, covering 9.98 million square kilometers (3.85 million square miles). Canada is more than 5 times larger than Indonesia in terms of land area.
thirdText.thfh3p6: Canada experiences four distinct seasons: spring, summer, fall, and winter Spring (March to May): In many parts of Canada, spring is characterized by mild temperatures and rain. spring temperatures can range from around 5°C to 20°C Summer (June to August): Summers in Canada are usually warm to hot, with temperatures ranging from 20°C to 35°C. Fall (September to November): The weather is usually mild and comfortable with temperatures ranging from 10°C to 20°C Winters in Canada are cold and snowy, with temperatures dropping well below freezing. Winter temperatures can range from around -10°C to -35°C depending on the region.

topText.uatp: A large country located in North America, with a population of approximately 330 million people. Its capital is Washington D.C. and the largest city is New York City. The United States education system offers a wide range of programs and degrees at the undergraduate and graduate levels. Many universities are recognized globally for their high academic standards, research facilities, and cultural diversity.

subTextL.subhfp0: The US has long history of providing quality of education, and many US universities consistently rank among the top in the world
subTextL.subhfp1: US universities offer a diverse range of academic programs across various fields.
subTextL.subhfp2: A degree from a US university is globally recognized and can open doors to career opportunities around the world.
subTextL.subhfp3: Many US universities are leaders in research and offer students the opportunity to work with world-class researchers and access cutting-edge facilities.

subTextR.subpr1: Rencanakan masa depanmu dengan Salak Ed
subTextR.subrpt1: With over 25 years of industry experience and nationwide partnerships
subTextR.subrpt2: High acceptance rates, international experience, and comprehensive support
subTextR.subrpt3: 100% employment rate and focus on a great living experience

thirdText.thfh1: Living cost major cities in the US
thirdText.thfh1p1: New York City is the largest city in the US. Rent for a one-bedroom apartment in Manhattan can range from $2,500 to $4,500 per month. Other monthly expenses, including food, transportation, and utilities, can range from $1,000 to $1,500.
thirdText.thfh1p2: Rent for a one-bedroom apartment can range from $1,800 to $3,000 per month, while other monthly expenses can range from $800 to $1,200.
thirdText.thfh1p3: Rent for a one-bedroom apartment can range from $3,000 to $4,500 per month, while other monthly expenses can range from $1,000 to $1,500.
thirdText.thfh1p4: Rent for a one-bedroom apartment can range from $1,500 to $2,500 per month, while other monthly expenses can range from $800 to $1,200.
thirdText.thfh1p5: Rent for a one-bedroom apartment can range from $2,500 to $3,500 per month, while other monthly expenses can range from $1,000 to $1,500.
thirdText.thfh2: International Student in the United States
thirdText.thfh2p1: International students who want to study in the United States need to obtain a student visa, also known as an F-1 visa. Here are the steps:
thirdText.thfh2p3l1: Apply to Student and Exchange Visitor Program(SEVP) approved school to obtain I-20 form.
thirdText.thfh2p3l2: Pay Student and Exchange Visitor Information System (SEVIS) fee.
thirdText.thfh2p3l3: Students must complete the DS-160 application for a nonimmigrant visa online and upload a photo.
thirdText.thfh2p3l4: Students must schedule and attend an interview at the nearest U.S. embassy or consulate in their home country.
thirdText.thfh2p3l5: If the visa is approved, students will receive their F-1 visa and can make plans to travel to the United States.
thirdText.thfh2p2: International students who are studying full-time on an F-1 visa are generally eligible to work part-time on-campus while they are enrolled in school. International students can work on-campus up to 20 hours per week while school is in session and up to 40 hours per week during school breaks. To be eligible for on-campus employment, students must maintain their F-1 status and be enrolled in a SEVP-certified school.
thirdText.thfh2p3: As of 2023, the federal minimum wage is $10.50 per hour, but many states and cities have their own minimum wage that is higher than the federal rate. Some states have minimum wages as high as $15 per hour.
thirdText.thfh2p4: International students who have completed their studies in the US may be eligible to work in the US for a period of time after graduation. This is known as Optional Practical Training (OPT). OPT allows F-1 students to work in their field of study for up to 12 months after completing their program of study. Students in certain STEM fields may be eligible for an additional 24 months of OPT extension. To be eligible for OPT, students must first apply and receive approval from the United States Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS). Students must apply for OPT no earlier than 90 days before their program end date and no later than 60 days after their program end date.
thirdText.thfh3: Geography Facts of the United States
thirdText.thfh3p5: The United States is located in North America and is bordered by Canada to the north and Mexico to the south. The country has a total land area of 9,147,593 square kilometers, making it the third largest country in the world by land area. There are 50 states in the United States of America. Each state has its own government and constitution, and together they make up the federal system of government in the US. The states are divided into five regions: the Northeast, Southeast, Midwest, Southwest, and West.
thirdText.thfh3p6: The United States has a diverse climate due to its large size and varied topography.

topText.ukatp: The United Kingdom is a popular destination for international students, with a rich academic history and world-class universities. As the birthplace of the English language, the UK is a great place for international students to improve their English skills. The capital city of the UK, London is a vibrant and bustling metropolis with a rich history and diverse cultural scene.

subTextL.subhfp0: The UK has a long history of academic excellence, with some of the world's best universities. These universities offer a wide range of degree programs and are known for their rigorous academic standards and high-quality teaching.
subTextL.subhfp1: The UK is a melting pot of different cultures and nationalities, making it a great place for international students to experience different perspectives and ways of life.
subTextL.subhfp2: The UK offers a range of work opportunities for international students, both during their studies and after graduation.
subTextL.subhfp3: UK universities have an excellent track record of producing highly employable graduates, with many top employers actively seeking out graduates from UK universities. This can be a great advantage for international students looking to launch their careers in the UK or back in their home country.

subTextR.subrpt1: With over 25 years of industry experience and nationwide partnerships
subTextR.subrpt2: High acceptance rates, international experience, and comprehensive support
subTextR.subrpt3: 100% employment rate and focus on a great living experience

thirdText.thfh1: Living cost major cities in the United Kingdom
thirdText.thfh1p1: London is one of the most expensive cities in the world to live in. Accommodation costs are particularly high, with the average monthly rent for a one-bedroom apartment in central London being around £1,500 - £2,000.
thirdText.thfh1p2: Edinburgh is the capital city of Scotland and is also a popular destination for tourists and students. Accommodation costs are lower than in London, with the average monthly rent for a one-bedroom apartment in central Edinburgh being around £800 - £1,200.
thirdText.thfh1p3: Manchester is a large city in the northwest of England. Accommodation costs in Manchester are generally lower than in London and Edinburgh, with the average monthly rent for a one-bedroom apartment in central Manchester being around £600 - £900.
thirdText.thfh1p4: Birmingham is a major city in the Midlands region of England. Accommodation costs in Birmingham are generally lower than in London or Edinburgh, with the average monthly rent for a one-bedroom apartment in central Birmingham being around £500 - £800
thirdText.thfh1p5: Bristol is a vibrant city in the southwest of England. Accommodation costs in Bristol are generally higher than in Birmingham, with the average monthly rent for a one-bedroom apartment in central Bristol being around £700 - £1,000.
thirdText.thfh2: International Student in the United Kingdom
thirdText.thfh2p1: International students who want to study in the UK usually need to apply for a Tier 4 (General) student visa. Here are general steps to apply study permit:
thirdText.thfh2p3l1: Apply to a recognized educational institution in the UK and obtain a letter of acceptance from the institution.
thirdText.thfh2p3l2: Check if you are eligible for a Tier 4 (General) student visa. You must meet the requirements, such as being able to speak, read, write, and understand English, having enough funds to support yourself during your studies, and meeting the course requirements.
thirdText.thfh2p3l3: Apply for a Tier 4 (General) student visa online on the UK government website or in your home country at a visa application center. Need to submit your biometric information (fingerprints and photograph) as part of the application process. Pay visa fee.
thirdText.thfh2p3l4: Attend a visa interview, if required. The UK government may request an interview to verify your eligibility for the student visa.
thirdText.thfh2p3l5: Receive your visa decision. If your application is approved, you will receive your visa sticker or Biometric Residence Permit (BRP) in your passport.
thirdText.thfh2p2: International students who hold a Tier 4 (General) student visa are generally allowed to work part time while studying in the UK.
thirdText.thfh2p3lw1: Part-time work: International students with a Tier 4 (General) student visa can work part-time during term-time for up to 20 hours per week. They can work full-time during scheduled breaks and holidays.
thirdText.thfh2p3lw2: Work placements: If the course of study includes a work placement as part of the curriculum, international students may be able to work full-time during the placement period
thirdText.thfh2p3: The minimum wage in the UK varies depending on the age of the worker and whether they are an apprentice. Here are the current minimum wage rates in the UK as of April 2023:
thirdText.thfh2p4: After completing their studies, international students may be eligible to switch to a Tier 2 (General) work visa if they have a job offer from a UK employer that is willing to sponsor their visa. Once granted a Tier 2 (General) work visa, international students can work in the UK for up to 5 years. Alternatively, UK Graduates routes allow the international student to stay in the UK and work upon graduation. This is unsponsored, which means you can look for work at any levels after you graduate up to two years form undergraduate and master’s degree and three years for PhD graduates.
thirdText.thfh3: Geography Facts of the United Kingdom
thirdText.thfh3p5: The United Kingdom (UK) is a country located in Western Europe. It is made up of four countries: England, Scotland, Wales, and Northern Ireland. The UK has a total population of approximately 67 million people (as of 2021). The UK has a total area of approximately 243,610 square kilometers, with a coastline stretching over 12,429 kilometers.
thirdText.thfh3p6: he climate of the United Kingdom is classified as a temperate maritime climate, which means it is mild, wet, and changeable throughout the year.

tophero.ap: Salak Education Consulting is an education agency based in Bogor, Indonesia and Waterloo, Canada. We provide assistance for students to pursue their dream study abroad.

second.asp: We believe every people deserve to have a meaningful life by pursuing the best education that the world can offer to. Moving to a new country can be challenging for any international students. We were there too! Moved from Indonesia to Canada in 2009, we have experienced on how to study, live and work in Canada. We aim to pass down our study and life abroad experience to all students.
